Description: Fragment of foot and bowl of probably South Italian black-glazed pottery cup; ring foot, with spiral of paint on underside on floor; inside, stamped decoration, four stamps of uncertain vegetal nature; two grooved rings outside and one inside them.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 67, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GR.10)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: VIII.3 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
